issue.title: Using DevTools without ejx
issue.body: It should be good in documentation you show an example of how to use devtools without using EJX syntax.

pull_request.title: Make the `first` binding function return only live members
pull_request.body:
Previously, when running in a standalone topology and using a bind to
`first` in a template (as in `bind.foo.first.sys.ip`), the first
member of the bound group that the supervisor knew about was returned
regardless of whether it was alive or not.

This can obviously cause issues if you try to, say, bind to a database
server that is long gone.

Now `first` returns the first live member.

Signed-off-by: Christopher Maier <cmaier@chef.io>

Thanks for the pull request! Here is what will happen next:

issue.title: Angular form not invoking #mapStateToThis
issue.body: I'm refactoring a legacy Angular app and right now I have a controller with #mapStateToThis managing an Angular form. Unfortunately, changes to the form do not cause #mapStateToThis to fire. Are there any workarounds besides attaching a dummy action creator to the form #onChange?

comment.body:
@frankandrobot Super late response but are you still having issues? I'm trying to clean up issues.

If you still need help, can you reopen and post some code so we can help you out? üôè

issue.title: Add filter box for builder repo picker
issue.body:
Currently, all of a user's repos are being loaded and displayed. An input field to filter the repos would be a big improvement to UX.

To be used wherever the repo picker is being implemented.

issue.title: TypeError: _redux.compose.apply(...) is not a function
issue.body:
Hi all,
I'm implementing ng-redux in an old project, all works fine in development but all karma tests fails with the message:

`TypeError: _redux.compose.apply(...) is not a function`

May I need to add something to karma.conf?

comment.body: @karlos1337 @guysenpai  Can either of you guys create a repo reproducing this so I can take a look?

Thanks for the pull request! Here is what will happen next:
 1. Your PR will be reviewed by the maintainers
 2. If everything looks good, one of them will `approve` it, and your PR will be merged.

Thank you for contributing!

issue.title: Dist should have source map, min and regular versions
Dist should have source map, min and regular versions
ngRedux.connect mapStateToTarget  is a direct reference to the state object by consequence is really easy to mutate

comment.body: As @yadielar mentioned it's a shallow copy, so its actually working as expected.

commits.message:
Make the `first` binding function return only live members

Previously, when running in a standalone topology and using a bind to
`first` in a template (as in `bind.foo.first.sys.ip`), the first
member of the bound group that the supervisor knew about was returned
regardless of whether it was alive or not.

This can obviously cause issues if you try to, say, bind to a database
server that is long gone.

Now `first` returns the first live member.

Signed-off-by: Christopher Maier <cmaier@chef.io>
